title: Gregg Popovich to be U.S. basketball coach
text:
Gregg Popovich to be U.S. basketball head coach in 2017 Andrew Joseph , azcentral sports 10:17 a.m. MST October 23, 2015 San Antonio Spurs coach Gregg Popovich reacts against the Los Angeles Clippers in game five of the first round of the NBA Playoffs at Staples Center. The Spurs defeated the Clippers 111-107 to take a 3-2 lead. (Photo: Kirby Lee-USA TODAY Sports) 
With Duke head coach Mike Krzyzewski set to coach his final Olympic Games in 2016, USA Basketball was faced with a huge decision. 
Why not go with a five-time NBA champion? 
USA Basketball Chairman Jerry Colangelo announced Friday that Spurs head coach Gregg Popovich will take over as coach of the U.S. men's basketball team from 2017 to 2020. Krzyzewski will move into a special advisory role. 
Popovich is the mastermind behind the Spurs and should have no problem following Krzyzewski who led the U.S. to Olympic gold medals in 2008 and 2012. He is 75-1 and U.S. head coach. Gregg Popovich named head coach of USA Basketball Men’s National Team for 2017-20: https://t.co/S8304VMlFQ #USABMNT pic.twitter.com/nc93uuh282 — USA Basketball (@usabasketball) October 23, 2015 
“I’m extremely humbled and honored to have the opportunity to represent our country as the coach of the USA National Team,” said Popovich in a statement . “What the program has accomplished over the last decade under the leadership of Jerry Colangelo and Mike Krzyzewski is truly impressive. I will do my utmost to maintain the high standards of success, class and character established by Jerry, Coach K and the many players who have sacrificed their time on behalf of USA Basketball.” 
Best of all, we get to see Pop deal with international media!
